comments.body: FYI, we don't have a keep-open label yet.
Please point out that a comment on the PR will keep it open for another 30 days, as well.

> Please point out that a comment on the PR will keep it open for another 30 days, as well.

Actually, it will keep it open for 90 more days

Feel free to re-open and maybe add the "keep-open" label if this happens to a

comments.body: Do we want to run node and cluster level e2es for trivial PRs like comment changes, or docs changes? Running unit/integration tests is necessary for even those PRs today.

This only partly a change what's happening today (which is non-sense)

At this very instant:
`e2e-not-required` means that `Jenkins GCE e2e` need never pass.
`Jenkins GCE Node e2e` and `Jenkins unit/integration` still must pass (at least) once.

`e2e-not-required` cause it to not trigger a retest before merge. But if a retest was triggered ALL of e2e, node, and unit/integration had to run (and pass) a second time.

This just makes the policy clear. All must pass once. All or none must pass twice.

Got it.
Until we have means to not trigger `GCE e2e` and `GCE Node e2e` on PRs that
don't require them, can we have a flag to rerun just the `unit/integration`
tests for certain PRs?
The reason for wanting this split is to merge trivial PRs by reducing the
possibility of test flakes on them.

On Tue, Jun 7, 2016 at 3:49 PM, Eric Paris notifications@github.com wrote:

> In docs/devel/automation.md
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/27001#discussion_r66166577
> :
> 
> > -   \* it has passed the cla pre-submit and has the `cla:yes` label
> > -   \* it has passed the travis pre-submit tests
> > -   \* one (or all) of
> > -      \* its author is in kubernetes/contrib/submit-queue/whitelist.txt
> > -      \* its author is in contributors.txt via the github API.
> > -      \* the PR has the `ok-to-merge` label
> > -   \* One (or both of)
> > -      \* it has passed the Jenkins e2e test
> > 
> > ## \-      \* it has the `e2e-not-required` label
> > 
> > -Note that the combined whitelist/committer list is available at
> > -[submit-queue.k8s.io](http://submit-queue.k8s.io)
> > -  \* The PR must have the label "cla: yes" or "cla: human-approved"
> > -  \* The PR must be mergeable. aka cannot need a rebase
> > -  \* All of the following github statuses must be green
> > -     \* Jenkins GCE Node e2e
> 
> This only partly a change what's happening today (which is non-sense)
> 
> At this very instant:
> e2e-not-required means that Jenkins GCE e2e need never pass.
> Jenkins GCE Node e2e and Jenkins unit/integration still must pass (at
> least) once.
> 
> e2e-not-required cause it to not trigger a retest before merge. But if a
> retest was triggered ALL of e2e, node, and unit/integration had to run (and
> pass) a second time.
> 
> This just makes the policy clear. All must pass once. All or none must
> pass twice.
>

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +77,81 @@  * The PR must be mergeable. aka cannot need a rebase
  * All of the following github statuses must be green
     * Jenkins GCE Node e2e
     * Jenkins GCE e2e
     * Jenkins unit/integration

comments.body: Should you comment what happens if the e2e flakes?  Will my PR be evaluated again in the next pass?  Is there a manual intervention needed at that point?
I think it will be reevaluated in the next pass, but arguably that's a bug?
documented (and agree that it's kind of a bug, but catching flaky tests in the submit-queue requires more infrastructure...)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +86,90 @@
If the PR has the `e2e-not-required` label, it is simply merged.
If the PR does not have this label, e2e tests are re-run, if these new tests pass, the PR is merged.

If e2e flakes or is currently buggy, the PR will not be merged, but it will be re-run on the following

comments.body: Add: Its current status can be found at http://submit-queue.k8s.io/
